name: All Answers Are A's Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which book of the Bible comes after John?
questions.explanation:
Acts & Acts of the Apostles.

	Matthew, Mark, Luke, John, Acts are the first five books of the New Testament.

questions.text: What is a synonym for opposite?
questions.explanation:
antonym.

	A synonym is a word that means the same as another word.

questions.text: What is the name of the little red haired orphan?
questions.explanation:
Annie.

	Annie's dog's name was Sandy.

questions.text: In the song "Joseph's Coat" from "Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat" what color comes directly after "rose"?
questions.explanation:
azure.

	"It was red, and yellow, and green and brown, and scarlet and black and orchid and peach and ruby and olive and violet and fawn and lilac and gold and chocolate and mauve. Cream and crimson and silver and rose and azure...."

questions.text: My capital is Montgomery. I am a state in the US. Which state am I?
questions.explanation:
Alabama.

	Helen Keller was born in Alabama on June 27, 1880.

questions.text: Which Disney character had a monkey named Abu?
questions.explanation:
Aladdin.

	Brad Kane was the singing voice for Aladdin.

questions.text: In Veggietales, what kind of vegetable was Jr.?
questions.explanation:
asparagus.

	Jr. is the youngest of the vegetables.

questions.text: Who was Lou Costello's business partner?
questions.explanation:
Bud Abbott & Abbott.

	Costello: I don't know.Abbott: Third base.

questions.text: What is the English translation of "siempre"?
questions.explanation:
always.

	The Coca-Cola slogan in Spanish is "Siempre Coca-Cola" (Always Coca-Cola).

questions.text: What was Helen Keller's middle name?
questions.explanation:
Adams.

	Helen Keller graduated cum laude with honors in German from Radcliffe College. Not bad for a person who people considered to be "a wild animal."
